title: Datasworn v2.0.0-dev (data entry)
description: Data entry schema for Datasworn, which provides templates, fallbacks/default values for many undefined keys, and other conveniences like source inheritance. It must be processed into the standard Datasworn format.

MoveID.description: A move ID, for a standard move or a unique asset move

Label.description: A localized plain text name or label.

ChallengeRank.description: Challenge rank, represented as a number: 1 = Troublesome, 2 = Dangerous, 3 = Formidable, 4 = Extreme, 5 = Epic

result.description: A string template that may be used in place of OracleTableRow#result.

summary.description: A string template that may be used in place of OracleTableRow#summary.

description.description: A string template that may be used in place of OracleTableRow#description.

oracle.description: The ID of the oracle table to be rolled. If omitted, it defaults to the ID of this oracle table.

allOf.description: Describes the rendering of this oracle as a standalone table.

MoveRollMethod.description:
`any`: When rolling with this move trigger option, the player picks which stat to use.

`all`: When rolling with this move trigger option, *every* stat or progress track of the `using` key is rolled.

`highest`: When rolling with this move trigger option, use the highest/best option from the `using` key.

`lowest`: When rolling with this move trigger option, use the lowest/worst option from the `using` key.

text.description:
A markdown string containing the primary trigger text for this move.

Secondary trigger text (for specific stats or uses of an asset ability) may be described described in Trigger#roll_options.

A markdown string containing the primary trigger text for this move.

Secondary trigger text (for specific stats or uses of an asset ability) may be described described in Trigger#roll_options.

A markdown string containing the primary trigger text for this move.

Secondary trigger text (for specific stats or uses of an asset ability) may be described described in Trigger#roll_options.

assets.description: Asset IDs (which may be wildcards) that may be attached to this asset

max.description: Omit if there's no upper limit to the number of attached assets.

shared.description: Most assets only benefit to their owner, but certain assets (like Starforged's module and command vehicle assets) are shared amongst the player's allies, too.

count_as_impact.description: If `true`, this asset counts as an impact (Starforged) or a debility (classic Ironsworn).

moves.description: Unique moves added by this asset ability.

count_as_impact.description: If `true`, this asset counts as an impact (Starforged) or a debility (classic Ironsworn).

shared.description: Most assets only benefit to their owner, but certain assets (like Starforged's module and command vehicle assets) are shared amongst the player's allies, too.

extra_card.description: An additional theme or domain card for use with optional rules in Ironsworn: Delve.

encounter.description: The ID of the relevant encounter, if one is specified.

result.default: You transition into a new theme
You transition into a new domain

Rarity.description: A rarity, as described in Ironsworn: Delve.

asset.description: The asset enhanced by this rarity.

xp_cost.description:
From Ironsworn: Delve, p. 174:

      Some assets will bring a rarity into play more often than others, so the experience point cost for a rarity will vary by the linked asset. These costs are shown in the tables on page 175.

      If you are playing solo, and arent concerned with the relative balance of rarity abilities, you can ignore these variable costs. If so, spend 3 experience points to purchase a rarity.

Ruleset.description: The ruleset used for a sourcebook's rules content.

SvgImageURL.title: SVG Image URL
SvgImageURL.description: A relative URL pointing to a vector image in the SVG format.

WebpImageURL.title: WEBP Image URL
WebpImageURL.description: A relative URL pointing to a raster image in the WEBP format.

title.description: The title of the source document.

email.description: An optional email contact for the author

date.description: The date of the source documents's last update, formatted YYYY-MM-DD. Required because it's used to determine whether the data needs updating.

url.description: An absolute URL where the source document is available.

license.description: An absolute URL pointing to the location where this element's license can be found.
